page.title: 10Village school - Baston
page.content: The headmaster has been at the school for three years and finds it the friendliest he has encountered in 16 years of teaching.The{school}has 71 pupils aged between 5 and 11 years. There are 3 full time teachers (as well as the headmaster) and 1 part time.Most of the children live in the village but a few travel from Greatford and West Deeping by their parents choice.The discipline in the school is applied only where necessary and often democratically-the victims decide on the punishment,under supervision of the headmaster. Corporal punishment is never used. The activities in lunch and break times include chess, craft, country dancing, drama and many forms of sport.The headmaster finds that he works for two hours each weekday evening and about 4 hours over weekends marking and admin.
